byline.original: By JASON HOROWITZ and AMY CHOZICK

lead_paragraph: The pursuit of campaign financing highlights another stark contrast between the two major Democratic candidates.

headline.print_headline: Small Gifts to Sanders Challenge the Clinton Fund-Raising Model
headline.main: Small Gifts to Bernie Sanders Challenge Hillary Clinton Fund-Raising Model

snippet: The pursuit of campaign financing highlights another stark contrast between the two major Democratic candidates.
abstract: Sen Bernie Sanders's bare-bones campaign finance strategy, which relies on social media and online credit card transactions, has proven successful and may challenge traditional fund-raising model; Sanders has raised around $96 million with minimal time investment, while rival Hilary Clinton has repeatedly left campaign trial for meetings with wealthy donors.
